page.title: 13The Bell Inn - Salhouse 1
page.content: The Bell Inn was originally called the Blue Bell Inn from the surrounding bluebell fields.The licensee Mr Colman sells more than seven kinds of beer, thirty kinds of spirits and pub food and snacks.The most popular drink is a well-known Danish lager.The Inn also sells cigarettes and there is a Space-Invaders game. The building dates from 1620 but has twice been extended in 1928 and 1979. There is a{Beer Garden}where children can go with their parents.During the winter the Inn has a group of about twenty 'regulars', but this number is swelled to about two hundred with the summer visitors from the nearby{ {Norfolk Broads.}Some of the ladies make up a{darts team.}The Inn is advertised on beer mats and towels supplied by the brewery. (contd)
